definition: to step across/to stride over/to straddle/to span
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more

sentences.english: The second stride is a leap in its economic and social development.
sentences.chinese: 第二個跨越，經濟社會實現跨越式發展。

sentences.english: Technology and market together impel the telecommunication industry to implement leap - forward development.
sentences.chinese: 摘要技術和市場共同推動了信息產業的跨越式發展。

sentences.english: Since the middle 90s, Tonghua medical industry has realised the development by a handsome margin.
sentences.chinese: 90年代中期以來，通化醫藥工業實現了跨越式發展。

sentences.english: On economic construction, Tibet has achieved leapfrog development.
sentences.chinese: 第二，經濟發展和人民生活水平實現跨越式發展。

sentences.english: Guoxin Communications achieved great-leap-forward development, with its brand-new state and vigorous momentum since its establishment.
sentences.chinese: 公司自成立以來，依靠科技創新，實現了跨越式發展。

sentences.english: It is the effective system arrangement that acts as the crux of the jump-over development in the late-start states.
sentences.chinese: 有效的制度安排是後發國家實現跨越式發展的關鍵。

sentences.english: A step-change development has been achieved in information infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 信息基礎設施建設實現跨越式發展。

sentences.english: Langfang City schools for economic development by leaps and bounds to make a great contribution.
sentences.chinese: 學校爲廊坊市經濟跨越式發展做出了巨大貢獻。

sentences.english: Thermoelectrics is going to leapfrog forward if you have better materials.
sentences.chinese: 如果有更好的材料，熱電技術會跨越式前進。

definition: to advance by leaps and bounds
to overtake on a bend (driving)/(fig.) taking opportunity of tight corners to make swift progress (economy etc)
to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
